txt.en: 'We have always had to defend our lands from the creatures of the wild, and from bands of roaming Orcs. But things have never been this bad in Wildermore.'
Follow Gárwig and speak with him
'Well, at least we have defeated them, from the looks of it. You there -- tell me what happened here.'
Speak with Gárwig at the gate.

'I... I cannot believe this. What do we do?'

Cyneberg recovers a little when she sees her Reeve lying still in the snow.

'We must get the Reeve indoors at once. He is too frail to be out in the snow!'

Gárwig is pale and breathless, his eyes wide in his shock at the cruel death of his remaining sons.

'Why did it not take me instead? What does the creature want with us?

'How can it be stopped?'
While speaking with Gárwig, a villager warns of a frightened townsfolk and a disturbance at the western gate.
'We have always had to defend our lands from the creatures of the wild, and from bands of roaming Orcs. But things have never been this bad in Wildermore.'
A disturbance at the west gate has come to the attention of the Reeve.
Instance: A Disturbance at the Gate
Gárwig is in the Mead Hall of Forlaw.\n\nYou should speak with Gárwig.
